changelog.version:
* Skill training actions have 150% exp.
* Practical magic updates the gold cost tooltip correctly
* Ping on Pause toggle saves on refresh
* Started French support (thanks to Guizmus)
* Haggle tooltip updates on reset correctly. Continue On mana reduction tooltip works.
* Can't use repeat last action to get around training caps
* New actions - Adventure Guild, Crafting Guild, Gather Team
* Short Quest mana cost 800 -> 600. LQuest mana cost 2k -> 1500, gold reward 25 -> 30
* Buy Supplies requires 400 -> 300 gold.
* Wild Mana 200 gain -> 250 gain.
* Removing old versions as I add new ones now
* Removed Get Drunk's gold cost, gave it 3x exp

* Changed formula for how Old Shortcut reduces Continue On
* Repeat last action on list saves now
* Lootable first checkboxes save now
* Window title switches when paused correctly
* Dragging an action image doesn't change the URL in firefox
* 2 more story parts, unlocked at Small Dungeon completion
* Re-arrange icon/loop count order on lists
* Get Drunk removes 2 gold instead of adding it

* Sound on pause available in options
* training limit set to 50 from 10 (for now)
* Mana Original is multipled by # loops
* Travel Action styling change
* Saving in town 3
* DRAG AND DROP (Thanks to Hunter)

* Tooltip on reset button
* Glasses give x2 to forest
* Mana cost reflects the tooltips now rather than an average of stat reduction
* Trainings are capped at 10 per loop
* New actions! Brew Potions, Continue On, Explore City, Gamble, Get Drunk, Purchase Mana, Sell Potions
* Some new actions are usless at the moment.

* Reverted skill nerf (too harsh)
* Actually capped glasses
* Sell Gold -> Buy Mana
* Double soulstone recovery
* Nerfed practical magic (more uses for it later)

* Nerfed the soulstone nerf
* Cleared additional purple bars on exp
* Corrected glasses/throw party tooltips
* Actually nerfed skill growth - it's cheaper than before for level 2 - 23, and about 4x harder at level 100
* Add action to top of list option

q_a.a: Hover over "Stats" for how they work. What stats are important depend on what actions you need that uses them.
Short runs are better, for the early game and current balance. As your runs get longer and you accrue talent and soulstones they become more useful.

q_a.q: What should my first goal be?
q_a.a: Start with wandering until you have ways of getting mana back. Then try to find how to get some combat training which gives you a permanent boost, and then try fighting monsters!

body.tutorial:
TUTORIAL
Click the Wander action and click Play to start.
Wander for a bit, then smash pots.
Watch the numbers change, read all the tooltips.
Complete the town, go to the next one.

time_controls.restart_text: Resets the loop. Not a hard reset.

stories.story: You're a simple courier, on a long trip to deliver a high priority package. Just as you entered town, you tripped - breaking your glasses - and the package burst open, spilling a strange liquid on you. Immediately, your meager amount of mana started draining rapidly. Right as your mana became empty, you found yourself back in the moment the liquid was absorbed into your skin, with your tiny reserves filled... yet draining just as before. This happened again and again, the world resetting with you, until you decided you had to figure out a way to prolong how long these 'loops' were. Mana crystals are often stored in pottery around town, perhaps you'll start there ...

You reach the end of the dungeon, where a softly glowing orb floats on a pedastal. You've found the dungeon core - for the first level of the dungeon, at least. As you grasp it, the essence dives into you, infusing your very being with the power it holds. It is a small amount of power, but this is a small dungeon. You'll be back to take this power again, knowing with the foreign knowledge implanted that it will stay with you no matter when you are.

You reach the end of the dungeon again, but for the first time the core isn't glowing. It's always been thought that dungeon cores build based on the mana spent around them, but you're beginning to think the essence of it's previous incarnations drains it somehow. It doesn't always happen, but you'll need to put more mana into the world to take the core's benefits out of it. You shrug, accepting yet another oddity of the loops.

tooltip.explanation:
Each stat level reduces the relevant part of an action's mana cost by 1%.
Talent gets 1% of all level progress, and keeps through loops.
Each talent level increases Bonus XP of its skill by 1%.
XP gain towards an stat per action is (actual mana / original mana) * (talent %) per tick.
Bonus XP is a combination of talent and soulstone bonuses.

e.g. Meet People costs 800 mana and has a breakdown of
Int
10%
Cha
80%
Soul
10%.
This effectively means 80 of the mana is controlled by
Int
, another 80 by
Soul
, and the remaining 640 by
Cha
.
If your
Cha
is level 20 when the action is started, it'd be 640 / 1.2 = 533.333
Adding back the 160 from
Soul
and
Int
, the total mana the action takes (rounded up) is now 694, so ~15% less mana.
The action would give (800/694)*(1+talent/100) level exp per mana for the 694 mana.

magic.label: Magic
magic.desc: Control the aether to cast and conjure.

practical_magic.label: Practical Magic
practical_magic.desc: Mage Hand, Prestidigitation, Detect Magic, and other useful tricks to help out.

Long Quests get 1% more gold per level from 201-400 (rounded down).

alchemy.label: Alchemy
alchemy.desc: Brewing potions is hard work! It's a good thing you found a teacher.
alchemy.desc2: The Magic teacher in Beginnersville adores alchemists. +1% to Mage Lessons (rounded down) per level.

Updates every completed action.
Accurate at end of run.

wander.label: Wander
wander.tooltip: Explore the town, look for hidden areas and treasures.

meet_people.label: Meet People
meet_people.tooltip:
They won't let you get away with a simple chat.
Unlocked at 22% Explored.

investigate.label: Investigate
investigate.tooltip:
You've been hearing some rumors...
Unlocked at 25% People Met.

explore_forest.label: Explore Forest
explore_forest.tooltip:
What a pleasant area.
2x progress with glasses.

old_shortcut.label: Old Shortcut
old_shortcut.tooltip:
No one has come down this way in quite some time.
Gives some additional herbs.
Gives something to talk about with the Hermit. Get 1% reward for Talk to Hermit result per 1% Shortcut Explored.
Unlocked at 20% Forest Explored.

hermit.label: Talk To Hermit
hermit.tooltip:
This old man is happy to have a listening ear, surely he has some useful knowledge. You hope.
Speed is 1% faster for Gather Herbs, Practical Magic, and Learn Alchemy per 1% of Hermit Knowledge.
Unlocked with both 20% Shortcut Explored and 40 Magic.

explore_city.label: Explore City
explore_city.tooltip:
Everyone is so busy, and there's so much to do.
2x progress with glasses.

get_drunk.label: Get Drunk
get_drunk.tooltip:
Sometimes you just need a drink.
Requires reputation greater than -3.
Has 3x exp
Costs 1 reputation.
Unlocked at 20% City Explored.

buy_glasses.label: Buy Glasses
buy_glasses.tooltip:
That's not fair. There was time now. There was all the time I needed.
Now you have to get new glasses again for 10 gold!
Causes Wander to be 4x as effective for the rest of the loop.
Affects any action with the glasses icon
Can only have 1 Buy Glasses action.
Unlocked at 20% explored.

buy_mana.label: Buy Mana
buy_mana.tooltip:
1 gold = 50 mana. Buys all the mana you can.
Unlocked at 20% Explored.

train_str.label: Train Strength
train_str.tooltip:
Build up those muscles. Again.
Has 4x exp/talent gain, and can only be done
times per reset
Unlocked at 5% People Met.

train_dex.label: Train Dex
train_dex.tooltip:
The kids are a little mad you're taking their playground. They'll get over it.
Has 4x exp/talent gain, and can only be done
times per reset
Unlocked at 15% People Met.

train_spd.label: Train Speed
train_spd.tooltip:
A new friend has a magical treadmill. Gotta go fast.
Has 4x exp/talent gain, and can only be done
times per reset
Unlocked at 30% People Met.

throw_party.label: Throw Party
throw_party.tooltip:
Take a break and socialize.
8x people met % over Meet People for equivalent mana cost.
Costs 2 reputation.
Unlocked at 30% Investigated.

warrior_lesson.label: Warrior Lessons
warrior_lesson.tooltip:
Learning to fight is probably important; you have a long journey ahead of you.
Requires 2 reputation.
Unlocked at 20% Investigated.

mage_lesson.label: Mage Lessons
mage_lesson.tooltip:
The mystic got you into this mess, maybe it can help you get out of it.
Requires 2 reputation.
Unlocked at 20% Investigated.

buy_supplies.label: Buy Supplies
buy_supplies.tooltip:
Prepare to move on.
Costs
gold.
You only need one set of supplies.
Unlocks at a combined skill of 35.

haggle.label: Haggle
haggle.tooltip:
They won't like you as much, but hey - you're leaving.
Costs 1 reputation to reduce the price of supplies by 20.
Unlocks at a combined skill of 35.

start_journey.label: Start Journey
start_journey.tooltip:
Follow the trail to end up at the next town. You need to keep moving until you can learn how to shut these loops off.
Costs 1 supplies. Finish once to unlock Forest Path's actions, then finish this in order to use Forest Path's actions.
Unlocks at a combined skill of 35.

train_soul.label: Sit By Waterfall
train_soul.tooltip:
It's peaceful here. Loud, but peaceful.
Has 4x exp/talent gain, and can only be done
times per reset
Unlocked at 70% Forest Explored.

practical_magic.label: Practical Magic
practical_magic.tooltip:
Such simple uses to help out with everyday tasks. Genius, really. It's like pulling teeth getting this knowledge from the Hermit though.
Unlocked with both 20% Hermit Knowledge and 50 Magic.

learn_alchemy.label: Learn Alchemy
learn_alchemy.tooltip:
You can listen to him yammer while making light healing and remedy potions.
You're starting to think the potion that caused you to loop time was a complex one.
You provide the ingredients; costs 10 herbs.
Gives alchemy and magic skill.
Unlocked with both 40% Hermit Knowledge and 60 Magic.

brew_potions.label: Brew Potions
brew_potions.tooltip:
Bubbles and Flasks. Potions and Magic.
Requires 5 reputation or he won't let you near his stuff.
Creates a potion from 10 herbs to sell at the next town.
Gives alchemy and magic skill.
Unlocked with 10 Alchemy.

continue_on.label: Continue On
continue_on.tooltip:
Keep walking to the next town, Merchanton.
Mana cost reduced by 60 per Old Shortcut %.

purchase_mana.label: Purchase Mana
purchase_mana.tooltip: 1 gold = 50 mana. Buys all the mana you can.

sell_potions.label: Sell Potions
sell_potions.tooltip: Potions are worth 1 gold per alchemy skill, but it takes a bit to find a seller.

read_books.label: Read Books
read_books.tooltip:
There's a library! You always loved reading.
Discover new worlds and perspectives, get ideas from fiction characters, and empathize with the desire to be stronger.
Requires glasses.
Has 4x exp/talent gain, and can only be done
times per reset
Unlocks at 50% city explored.

gather_team.label: Gather Team
gather_team.tooltip:
You don't have to take them on by yourself.
Max 5 other team members.
Costs
gold, and the cost goes up by 200 gold per member.
Each member adds (Rank Mult) * (Combat Skill + Magic Skill)/2 to your Team Combat.
Requires Adventure Guild.
Has 3x exp/talent gain.
Unlocks at 20% city explored.

smash_pots.label: Smash Pots
smash_pots.tooltip:
They're just sitting there, unbroken, full of potential.
Pots with loot in them have 100 mana.
Every 10 pots have mana.

locks.label: Pick Locks
locks.tooltip:
Don't worry; they won't remember.
Houses with loot in them have
locks.tooltip2:
gold.
Every 10 houses have gold.
Unlocked at 20% Explored.

short_quest.label: Short Quest
short_quest.tooltip:
Be a hero! ...If the reward is good and it doesn't take too long.
Short Quests with loot give
short_quest.tooltip2:
gold as a reward.
Every 5 Short Quests have loot.
Unlocked at 5% People Met.

long_quest.label: Long Quest
long_quest.tooltip:
Be a more impressive hero! ...As long as someone is watching.
Long Quests with loot give
long_quest.tooltip2:
gold and 1 reputation as a reward.
Every 5 Long Quests have loot.
Unlocked at 10% Investigated.

wild_mana.label: Wild Mana
wild_mana.tooltip:
They're out of sight of most travellers, but you have time to find and harvest them.
Every good mana spot has 250 mana.
Every 50 mana spots have good mana.

gather_herbs.label: Gather Herbs
gather_herbs.tooltip:
Might as well dig up anything useful you find.
Every 10 funny plants are herbs.
Unlocked at 10% Forest Explored.

hunt.label: Hunt
hunt.tooltip:
The forest provides.
Every 10 animals have good hides.
Unlocked at 40% Forest Explored.
NOTE: Using hide is not implemented yet. I'll remove this note when it is.

gamble.label: Gamble
gamble.info_text3: People to check if they're suckers
gamble.tooltip:
The cards still somehow come out different every time.
Has 2x exp/talent gain
Costs 20 gold and 1 reputation.
Requires reputation greater than -5.
You win against every 10 suckers, and get 60 gold for winning.

heal_sick.label: Heal The Sick
heal_sick.tooltip:
You won't be able to heal them all, but they'll be thankful for doing what you can.
Healing is always 3 parts, each with a main stat - Diagnose (Per), Treat (Int), Inform (Cha).
Gives (magic skill) * (1 + main stat / 100) * sqrt(1 + times completed / 100) * (original mana cost / actual mana cost) progress points per mana.
Requires 12 Magic skill.
Gives 3 reputation upon patient completion.

fight_monsters.label: Fight Monsters
fight_monsters.tooltip:
Slowly, you're figuring out their patterns.
Fighting rotates between 3 types of battles, each with a main stat - Quick (Spd), Defensive (Str), Aggressive (Con).
Gives (combat skill) * (1 + main stat / 100) * sqrt(1 + times completed / 100) * (original mana cost / actual mana cost) progress points per mana.
Requires 10 Combat skill.
Gives 20 gold per fight segment completion.

small_dungeon.label: Small Dungeon
small_dungeon.tooltip:
There are small changes each time; it's harder to get used to. The soulstones at the end last through loops, but they're not always in the dungeon... Strange.
The dungeon requires different skills at different points.
One action can clear multiple dungeons if your stats are high enough.
Gives (magic + combat skill) * (1 + main stat / 100) * sqrt(1 + times completed / 200) * (original mana cost / actual mana cost) progress points per mana.
Requires a combined skill of 35.
Gives 1 soulstone per completion - hover over Completed for info.
small_dungeon.completed_tooltip:
Each soulstone improves a random stat's exp gain by (1+(soulstones)^.8/10). Each soulstone reduces the chance you'll get the next one by 2%.
Chance to receive a soulstone recovers at .00002% per mana.

adventure_guild.label: Adventure Guild
adventure_guild.tooltip:
The one stop shop for all your adventuring needs.
Take their tests and get a rank!
You can only join 1 guild at a time, and only try once.
Gives 200 mana per rank.
Gives ((magic skill)/2 + (combat skill)) * (1 + main stat / 100) * sqrt(1 + times completed / 1000) * (original mana cost / actual mana cost) progress points per mana.
Unlocks at 20% rumors heard.

craft_guild.label: Crafting Guild
craft_guild.tooltip:
Learn to use your hands to build big structures.
Take their tests and get a rank!
You can only join 1 guild at a time, and only try once.
Gives 100 Crafting exp per rank.
Gives ((magic skill)/2 + (crafting skill)) * (1 + main stat / 100) * sqrt(1 + times completed / 1000) * (original mana cost / actual mana cost) progress points per mana.
Unlocks at 30% rumors heard
